Ontology Reuse on the basis of Decision Analysis (VII)
3. Quantifying preferences
3. Quantifying preferences
3.2. Quantifying preferences involves eliciting weights that represent the relative importance of 
criteria. 
Documentation availability and quality is the most important 
criteria, followed by adequacy of knowledge extractions and 
adequacy of implementation language and ontology 
evaluation, respectively.
